revision.text: {{Infobox Galaxy | name = [[New General Catalogue|NGC]] 4457 | image = [[File:NGC 4457.jpg|250px]] | caption= The galaxy NGC 4457. | epoch = [[J2000]] | type = (R)SAB(s)0/a, [[LINER]] <ref name="ned">{{cite web | title=NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database | work=Results for NGC 4457 | url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ | accessdate=2017-08-18}}</ref> | ra = {{RA|12|28|59.0}}<ref name="ned" /> | dec = {{DEC|03|34|14}}<ref name="ned" /> | dist_ly = 54,801,600 [[ly]] | group_cluster = [[Virgo Cluster]] | z = 0.002942/882 km/s<ref name="ned" /> | appmag_v =11.76 <ref name="ned" /> | size_v = 2.7 x 2.3<ref name="ned" /> | constellation name = [[Virgo (constellation)|Virgo]] | names = CGCG 42-124, IRAS 12264+0350, MCG 1-32-75, [[Principal Galaxies Catalogue|PGC]] 41101, [[Uppsala General Catalogue|UGC]] 7609, VCC 1145 <ref name="ned" /> |size=~ 38,687.32 ly}} '''NGC 4457''' is a [[spiral galaxy]] located about 55 million [[light-year]]s away<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://ned.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/objsearch?objname=NGC+4457&extend=no&hconst=73&omegam=0.27&omegav=0.73&corr_z=1&out_csys=Equatorial&out_equinox=J2000.0&obj_sort=RA+or+Longitude&of=pre_text&zv_breaker=30000.0&list_limit=5&img_stamp=YES|title=Your NED Search Results|website=ned.ipac.caltech.edu|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> in the [[constellation]] of [[Virgo (constellation)|Virgo]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://dso-browser.com/deep-sky/5503/ngc-4457/galaxy|title=Galaxy NGC 4457 - Galaxy in Virgo Constellation · Deep Sky Objects Browser|last=Rojas|first=Sebastián García|website=DSO Browser|language=en|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> It is also classified as a [[LINER]] galaxy, a class of [[Active galaxies|Active galaxy]] defined by their [[Spectral line|spectral line emissions]].<ref>{{Cite journal|last=TERASHIMA|first=YUICHI|last2=HO|first2=LUIS C.|last3=PTAK|first3=ANDREW F.|last4=MUSHOTZKY|first4=RICHARD F.|last5=SERLEMITSOS|first5=PETER J.|last6=YAQOOB|first6=TAHIR|last7=KUNIEDA|first7=HIDEYO|date=20 April 2000|title=ASCA OBSERVATIONS OF ''TYPE 2 '' LINERs: EVIDENCE FOR A STELLAR SOURCE OF IONIZATION|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1086/308690/pdf|journal=The Astrophysical Journal|volume=533|pages=729-743|via=}}</ref><ref name=":0" /> NGC 4457 Is inclined by about 33°.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Vollmer|first=B.|last2=Soida|first2=M.|last3=Beck|first3=R.|last4=Chung|first4=A.|last5=Urbanik|first5=M.|last6=Chyzy|first6=K.T.|last7=Otmianowska-Mazur|first7=K.|last8=Kenney|first8=J.D.P.|date=4 April 2013|title=Large-scale radio continuum properties of 19 Virgo cluster galaxies⋆ The influence of tidal interactions, ram pressure stripping, and accreting gas envelopes|url=https://arxiv.org/pdf/1304.1279v1.pdf|journal=Astronomy & Astrophysics|volume=553|pages=38|doi=10.1051/0004-6361/201321163|via=}}</ref> NGC 4457 was discovered by astronomer [[William Herschel]] on February 23, 1784.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://cseligman.com/text/atlas/ngc44a.htm#4457|title=New General Catalog Objects: NGC 4450 - 4499|website=cseligman.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-08-18}}</ref> NGC 4457 is a member of the [[Virgo cluster of galaxies|Virgo Cluster of galaxies]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://kudzu.astr.ua.edu/devatlas/NGC_4457______B___________.html|title=NGC 4457 - (R)SAB(s)a|last=|first=|date=|website=The de Vaucouleurs Atlas of Galaxies|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ned.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/NEDatt?objname=NGC+4457|title=Detailed Object Classifications|website=ned.ipac.caltech.edu|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> ==Physical characteristics== NGC 4457 has a broad oval zone containing an inner spiral. The inner spiral is defined mainly by two fairly open arms. There is a well-defined outer ring that is completely detached from the inner regions of the galaxy.<ref name=":1" /> ===Truncated disk=== NGC 4457 has a severely reduced amount of star-formation in it's disk while it's inner regions have a normalized rate of massive star formation.<ref name=":1" /> This may have been caused by a recent interaction of the gas in the galaxy and the gas in the surrounding cluster<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Cortes|first=Juan R.|last2=Kenney|first2=Jeffrey D. P.|last3=Hardy|first3=Eduardo|date=24 December 2014|title=INTEGRAL-FIELD STELLAR AND IONIZED GAS KINEMATICS OF PECULIAR VIRGO CLUSTER SPIRAL GALAXIES|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/0067-0049/216/1/9/pdf|journal=The Astrophysical Journal Supplement Series|volume=216:9|pages=34|via=}}</ref> causing the gas to get stripped away in effect known as [[Ram-pressure stripping|Ram Pressure Stripping]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.aip.de/~rpiontek/ram.html|title=Robert A. Piontek -- Ram Pressure Stripping|website=www.aip.de|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> == See also == * [[List of NGC objects (4001–5000)]] == External links == {{WikiSky}} * [http://dc.zah.uni-heidelberg.de/sasmirala/q/prod/qp/NGC%204457| Sasmirala page on NGC 4457] [[Category:Spiral galaxies]] [[Category:LINER galaxies]] [[Category:Virgo (constellation)]] [[Category:NGC objects|4457]] [[Category:Principal Galaxies Catalogue objects|41101]] [[Category:UGC objects|7609]] [[Category:Astronomical objects discovered in 1784]] [[Category:Virgo Cluster]] == References == {{reflist}} {{Ngc45}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox Galaxy | name = [[New General Catalogue|NGC]] 4457 | image = [[File:NGC 4457.jpg|250px]] | caption= The galaxy NGC 4457 | epoch = [[J2000]] | type = (R)SAB(s)0/a, [[LINER]] <ref name="ned">{{cite web | title=NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database | work=Results for NGC 4457 | url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ | accessdate=2017-08-18}}</ref> | ra = {{RA|12|28|59.0}}<ref name="ned" /> | dec = {{DEC|03|34|14}}<ref name="ned" /> | dist_ly = 54,801,600 [[ly]] | group_cluster = [[Virgo Cluster]] | z = 0.002942/882 km/s<ref name="ned" /> | appmag_v =11.76 <ref name="ned" /> | size_v = 2.7 x 2.3<ref name="ned" /> | constellation name = [[Virgo (constellation)|Virgo]] | names = CGCG 42-124, IRAS 12264+0350, MCG 1-32-75, [[Principal Galaxies Catalogue|PGC]] 41101, [[Uppsala General Catalogue|UGC]] 7609, VCC 1145 <ref name="ned" /> |size=~ 38,687.32 ly}} '''NGC 4457''' is a [[spiral galaxy]] located about 55 million [[light-year]]s away<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://ned.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/objsearch?objname=NGC+4457&extend=no&hconst=73&omegam=0.27&omegav=0.73&corr_z=1&out_csys=Equatorial&out_equinox=J2000.0&obj_sort=RA+or+Longitude&of=pre_text&zv_breaker=30000.0&list_limit=5&img_stamp=YES|title=Your NED Search Results|website=ned.ipac.caltech.edu|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> in the [[constellation]] of [[Virgo (constellation)|Virgo]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://dso-browser.com/deep-sky/5503/ngc-4457/galaxy|title=Galaxy NGC 4457 - Galaxy in Virgo Constellation · Deep Sky Objects Browser|last=Rojas|first=Sebastián García|website=DSO Browser|language=en|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> It is also classified as a [[LINER]] galaxy, a class of [[Active galaxies|active galaxy]] defined by their [[Spectral line|spectral line emissions]].<ref>{{Cite journal|last=TERASHIMA|first=YUICHI|last2=HO|first2=LUIS C.|last3=PTAK|first3=ANDREW F.|last4=MUSHOTZKY|first4=RICHARD F.|last5=SERLEMITSOS|first5=PETER J.|last6=YAQOOB|first6=TAHIR|last7=KUNIEDA|first7=HIDEYO|date=20 April 2000|title=ASCA OBSERVATIONS OF ''TYPE 2 '' LINERs: EVIDENCE FOR A STELLAR SOURCE OF IONIZATION|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1086/308690/pdf|journal=The Astrophysical Journal|volume=533|pages=729-743|via=}}</ref><ref name=":0" /> NGC 4457 Is inclined by about 33°.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Vollmer|first=B.|last2=Soida|first2=M.|last3=Beck|first3=R.|last4=Chung|first4=A.|last5=Urbanik|first5=M.|last6=Chyzy|first6=K.T.|last7=Otmianowska-Mazur|first7=K.|last8=Kenney|first8=J.D.P.|date=4 April 2013|title=Large-scale radio continuum properties of 19 Virgo cluster galaxies⋆ The influence of tidal interactions, ram pressure stripping, and accreting gas envelopes|url=https://arxiv.org/pdf/1304.1279v1.pdf|journal=Astronomy & Astrophysics|volume=553|pages=38|doi=10.1051/0004-6361/201321163|via=}}</ref> It was discovered by astronomer [[William Herschel]] on February 23, 1784.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://cseligman.com/text/atlas/ngc44a.htm#4457|title=New General Catalog Objects: NGC 4450 - 4499|website=cseligman.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-08-18}}</ref> It is a member of the [[Virgo cluster of galaxies|Virgo Cluster of galaxies]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://kudzu.astr.ua.edu/devatlas/NGC_4457______B___________.html|title=NGC 4457 - (R)SAB(s)a|last=|first=|date=|website=The de Vaucouleurs Atlas of Galaxies|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ned.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/NEDatt?objname=NGC+4457|title=Detailed Object Classifications|website=ned.ipac.caltech.edu|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref>
==Physical characteristics== NGC 4457 has a broad oval zone containing an inner spiral which is defined mainly by two fairly open arms. There is a well-defined outer ring that is completely detached from the inner regions of the galaxy.<ref name=":1" />
===Truncated disk=== NGC 4457 has a severely reduced amount of star-formation in its disk while its inner regions have a normalized rate of massive star formation.<ref name=":1" /> This may have been caused by a recent interaction of the gas in the galaxy with the gas in the surrounding cluster,<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Cortes|first=Juan R.|last2=Kenney|first2=Jeffrey D. P.|last3=Hardy|first3=Eduardo|date=24 December 2014|title=INTEGRAL-FIELD STELLAR AND IONIZED GAS KINEMATICS OF PECULIAR VIRGO CLUSTER SPIRAL GALAXIES|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/0067-0049/216/1/9/pdf|journal=The Astrophysical Journal Supplement Series|volume=216:9|pages=34|via=}}</ref> causing the gas to be stripped away in effect known as [[ram-pressure stripping]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.aip.de/~rpiontek/ram.html|title=Robert A. Piontek -- Ram Pressure Stripping|website=www.aip.de|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref>
== See also == * [[List of NGC objects (4001–5000)]] * [[Messier 104]] * [[Messier 60]]
== External links == {{WikiSky}} * [http://dc.zah.uni-heidelberg.de/sasmirala/q/prod/qp/NGC%204457|Sasmirala page on NGC 4457]

{{Infobox Galaxy | name = [[New General Catalogue|NGC]] 4457 | image = [[File:NGC 4457.jpg|250px]] | caption= The galaxy NGC 4457 | epoch = [[J2000]] | type = (R)SAB(s)0/a, [[LINER]] <ref name="ned">{{cite web | title=NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database | work=Results for NGC 4457 | url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ | accessdate=2017-08-18}}</ref> | ra = {{RA|12|28|59.0}}<ref name="ned" /> | dec = {{DEC|03|34|14}}<ref name="ned" /> | dist_ly = 54,801,600 [[Light-year|ly]] | group_cluster = [[Virgo Cluster]] | z = 0.002942/882 km/s<ref name="ned" /> | appmag_v =11.76 <ref name="ned" /> | size_v = 2.7 x 2.3<ref name="ned" /> | constellation name = [[Virgo (constellation)|Virgo]] | names = CGCG 42-124, IRAS 12264+0350, MCG 1-32-75, [[Principal Galaxies Catalogue|PGC]] 41101, [[Uppsala General Catalogue|UGC]] 7609, VCC 1145 <ref name="ned" /> |size=~ 38,687.32 ly}} '''NGC 4457''' is a [[spiral galaxy]] located about 55 million [[light-year]]s away<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://ned.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/objsearch?objname=NGC+4457&extend=no&hconst=73&omegam=0.27&omegav=0.73&corr_z=1&out_csys=Equatorial&out_equinox=J2000.0&obj_sort=RA+or+Longitude&of=pre_text&zv_breaker=30000.0&list_limit=5&img_stamp=YES|title=Your NED Search Results|website=ned.ipac.caltech.edu|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> in the [[constellation]] of [[Virgo (constellation)|Virgo]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://dso-browser.com/deep-sky/5503/ngc-4457/galaxy|title=Galaxy NGC 4457 - Galaxy in Virgo Constellation · Deep Sky Objects Browser|last=Rojas|first=Sebastián García|website=DSO Browser|language=en|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> It is also classified as a [[LINER]] galaxy, a class of [[Active galaxies|active galaxy]] defined by their [[Spectral line|spectral line emissions]].<ref>{{Cite journal|last=TERASHIMA|first=YUICHI|last2=HO|first2=LUIS C.|last3=PTAK|first3=ANDREW F.|last4=MUSHOTZKY|first4=RICHARD F.|last5=SERLEMITSOS|first5=PETER J.|last6=YAQOOB|first6=TAHIR|last7=KUNIEDA|first7=HIDEYO|date=20 April 2000|title=ASCA OBSERVATIONS OF ''TYPE 2 '' LINERs: EVIDENCE FOR A STELLAR SOURCE OF IONIZATION|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1086/308690/pdf|journal=The Astrophysical Journal|volume=533|pages=729–743|via=}}</ref><ref name=":0" /> NGC 4457 Is inclined by about 33°.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Vollmer|first=B.|last2=Soida|first2=M.|last3=Beck|first3=R.|last4=Chung|first4=A.|last5=Urbanik|first5=M.|last6=Chyzy|first6=K.T.|last7=Otmianowska-Mazur|first7=K.|last8=Kenney|first8=J.D.P.|date=4 April 2013|title=Large-scale radio continuum properties of 19 Virgo cluster galaxies⋆ The influence of tidal interactions, ram pressure stripping, and accreting gas envelopes|url=https://arxiv.org/pdf/1304.1279v1.pdf|journal=Astronomy & Astrophysics|volume=553|pages=38|doi=10.1051/0004-6361/201321163|via=}}</ref> It was discovered by astronomer [[William Herschel]] on February 23, 1784.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://cseligman.com/text/atlas/ngc44a.htm#4457|title=New General Catalog Objects: NGC 4450 - 4499|website=cseligman.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-08-18}}</ref> It is a member of the [[Virgo cluster of galaxies|Virgo Cluster of galaxies]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://kudzu.astr.ua.edu/devatlas/NGC_4457______B___________.html|title=NGC 4457 - (R)SAB(s)a|last=|first=|date=|website=The de Vaucouleurs Atlas of Galaxies|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ned.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/NEDatt?objname=NGC+4457|title=Detailed Object Classifications|website=ned.ipac.caltech.edu|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref>
==Physical characteristics== NGC 4457 has a broad oval zone containing an inner spiral which is defined mainly by two fairly open arms. There is a well-defined outer ring that is completely detached from the inner regions of the galaxy.<ref name=":1" />
===Truncated disk=== NGC 4457 has a severely reduced amount of star-formation in its disk while its inner regions have a normalized rate of massive star formation.<ref name=":1" /> This may have been caused by a recent interaction of the gas in the galaxy with the gas in the surrounding cluster,<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Cortes|first=Juan R.|last2=Kenney|first2=Jeffrey D. P.|last3=Hardy|first3=Eduardo|date=24 December 2014|title=INTEGRAL-FIELD STELLAR AND IONIZED GAS KINEMATICS OF PECULIAR VIRGO CLUSTER SPIRAL GALAXIES|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/0067-0049/216/1/9/pdf|journal=The Astrophysical Journal Supplement Series|volume=216:9|pages=34|via=}}</ref> causing the gas to be stripped away in effect known as [[ram-pressure stripping]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.aip.de/~rpiontek/ram.html|title=Robert A. Piontek -- Ram Pressure Stripping|website=www.aip.de|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref>

{{Infobox Galaxy | name = [[New General Catalogue|NGC]] 4457 | image = [[File:NGC 4457.jpg|250px]] | caption= The galaxy NGC 4457 | epoch = [[J2000]] | type = (R)SAB(s)0/a, [[LINER]] <ref name="ned">{{cite web | title=NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database | work=Results for NGC 4457 | url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ | accessdate=2017-08-18}}</ref> | ra = {{RA|12|28|59.0}}<ref name="ned" /> | dec = {{DEC|03|34|14}}<ref name="ned" /> | dist_ly = 54,801,600 [[Light-year|ly]] | group_cluster = [[Virgo Cluster]] | z = 0.002942/882 km/s<ref name="ned" /> | appmag_v =11.76 <ref name="ned" /> | size_v = 2.7 x 2.3<ref name="ned" /> | constellation name = [[Virgo (constellation)|Virgo]] | names = CGCG 42-124, IRAS 12264+0350, MCG 1-32-75, [[Principal Galaxies Catalogue|PGC]] 41101, [[Uppsala General Catalogue|UGC]] 7609, VCC 1145 <ref name="ned" /> |size=~ 38,687.32 ly}} '''NGC 4457''' is a [[spiral galaxy]] located about 55 million [[light-year]]s away<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://ned.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/objsearch?objname=NGC+4457&extend=no&hconst=73&omegam=0.27&omegav=0.73&corr_z=1&out_csys=Equatorial&out_equinox=J2000.0&obj_sort=RA+or+Longitude&of=pre_text&zv_breaker=30000.0&list_limit=5&img_stamp=YES|title=Your NED Search Results|website=ned.ipac.caltech.edu|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> in the [[constellation]] of [[Virgo (constellation)|Virgo]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://dso-browser.com/deep-sky/5503/ngc-4457/galaxy|title=Galaxy NGC 4457 - Galaxy in Virgo Constellation · Deep Sky Objects Browser|last=Rojas|first=Sebastián García|website=DSO Browser|language=en|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> It is also classified as a [[LINER]] galaxy, a class of [[Active galaxies|active galaxy]] defined by their [[Spectral line|spectral line emissions]].<ref>{{Cite journal|last=TERASHIMA|first=YUICHI|last2=HO|first2=LUIS C.|last3=PTAK|first3=ANDREW F.|last4=MUSHOTZKY|first4=RICHARD F.|last5=SERLEMITSOS|first5=PETER J.|last6=YAQOOB|first6=TAHIR|last7=KUNIEDA|first7=HIDEYO|date=20 April 2000|title=ASCA OBSERVATIONS OF ''TYPE 2 '' LINERs: EVIDENCE FOR A STELLAR SOURCE OF IONIZATION|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1086/308690/pdf|journal=The Astrophysical Journal|volume=533|pages=729–743|via=|arxiv = astro-ph/9911340 |bibcode = 2000ApJ...533..729T |doi = 10.1086/308690 }}</ref><ref name=":0" /> NGC 4457 Is inclined by about 33°.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Vollmer|first=B.|last2=Soida|first2=M.|last3=Beck|first3=R.|last4=Chung|first4=A.|last5=Urbanik|first5=M.|last6=Chyzy|first6=K.T.|last7=Otmianowska-Mazur|first7=K.|last8=Kenney|first8=J.D.P.|date=4 April 2013|title=Large-scale radio continuum properties of 19 Virgo cluster galaxies⋆ The influence of tidal interactions, ram pressure stripping, and accreting gas envelopes|url=https://arxiv.org/pdf/1304.1279v1.pdf|journal=Astronomy & Astrophysics|volume=553|pages=38|doi=10.1051/0004-6361/201321163|via=|arxiv = 1304.1279 |bibcode = 2013A&A...553A.116V }}</ref> It was discovered by astronomer [[William Herschel]] on February 23, 1784.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://cseligman.com/text/atlas/ngc44a.htm#4457|title=New General Catalog Objects: NGC 4450 - 4499|website=cseligman.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-08-18}}</ref> It is a member of the [[Virgo cluster of galaxies|Virgo Cluster of galaxies]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://kudzu.astr.ua.edu/devatlas/NGC_4457______B___________.html|title=NGC 4457 - (R)SAB(s)a|last=|first=|date=|website=The de Vaucouleurs Atlas of Galaxies|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ned.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/NEDatt?objname=NGC+4457|title=Detailed Object Classifications|website=ned.ipac.caltech.edu|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref>
==Physical characteristics== NGC 4457 has a broad oval zone containing an inner spiral which is defined mainly by two fairly open arms. There is a well-defined outer ring that is completely detached from the inner regions of the galaxy.<ref name=":1" />
===Truncated disk=== NGC 4457 has a severely reduced amount of [[Star formation|star-formation]] in its disk while its inner regions have a normalized rate of massive star formation.<ref name=":1" /> This may have been caused by a recent interaction of the gas in the galaxy with the gas in the surrounding cluster,<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Cortes|first=Juan R.|last2=Kenney|first2=Jeffrey D. P.|last3=Hardy|first3=Eduardo|date=24 December 2014|title=INTEGRAL-FIELD STELLAR AND IONIZED GAS KINEMATICS OF PECULIAR VIRGO CLUSTER SPIRAL GALAXIES|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/0067-0049/216/1/9/pdf|journal=The Astrophysical Journal Supplement Series|volume=216:9|pages=34|via=}}</ref> causing the gas to be stripped away in effect known as [[ram-pressure stripping]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.aip.de/~rpiontek/ram.html|title=Robert A. Piontek -- Ram Pressure Stripping|website=www.aip.de|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref>

{{Infobox Galaxy | name = [[New General Catalogue|NGC]] 4457 | image = [[File:NGC 4457.jpg|250px]] | caption= The galaxy NGC 4457 | epoch = [[J2000]] | type = (R)SAB(s)0/a, [[LINER]] <ref name="ned">{{cite web | title=NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database | work=Results for NGC 4457 | url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ | accessdate=2017-08-18}}</ref> | ra = {{RA|12|28|59.0}}<ref name="ned" /> | dec = {{DEC|03|34|14}}<ref name="ned" /> | dist_ly = 54,801,600 [[Light-year|ly]] | group_cluster = [[Virgo Cluster]] | z = 0.002942/882 km/s<ref name="ned" /> | appmag_v =11.76 <ref name="ned" /> | size_v = 2.7 x 2.3<ref name="ned" /> | constellation name = [[Virgo (constellation)|Virgo]] | names = CGCG 42-124, IRAS 12264+0350, MCG 1-32-75, [[Principal Galaxies Catalogue|PGC]] 41101, [[Uppsala General Catalogue|UGC]] 7609, VCC 1145 <ref name="ned" /> |size=~ 38,687.32 ly}} '''NGC 4457''' is a [[spiral galaxy]] located about 55 million [[light-year]]s away<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://ned.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/objsearch?objname=NGC+4457&extend=no&hconst=73&omegam=0.27&omegav=0.73&corr_z=1&out_csys=Equatorial&out_equinox=J2000.0&obj_sort=RA+or+Longitude&of=pre_text&zv_breaker=30000.0&list_limit=5&img_stamp=YES|title=Your NED Search Results|website=ned.ipac.caltech.edu|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> in the [[constellation]] of [[Virgo (constellation)|Virgo]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://dso-browser.com/deep-sky/5503/ngc-4457/galaxy|title=Galaxy NGC 4457 - Galaxy in Virgo Constellation · Deep Sky Objects Browser|last=Rojas|first=Sebastián García|website=DSO Browser|language=en|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref> It is also classified as a [[LINER]] galaxy, a class of [[Active galaxies|active galaxy]] defined by their [[Spectral line|spectral line emissions]].<ref>{{Cite journal|last=TERASHIMA|first=YUICHI|last2=HO|first2=LUIS C.|last3=PTAK|first3=ANDREW F.|last4=MUSHOTZKY|first4=RICHARD F.|last5=SERLEMITSOS|first5=PETER J.|last6=YAQOOB|first6=TAHIR|last7=KUNIEDA|first7=HIDEYO|date=20 April 2000|title=ASCA OBSERVATIONS OF ''TYPE 2 '' LINERs: EVIDENCE FOR A STELLAR SOURCE OF IONIZATION|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1086/308690/pdf|journal=The Astrophysical Journal|volume=533|pages=729–743|via=|arxiv = astro-ph/9911340 |bibcode = 2000ApJ...533..729T |doi = 10.1086/308690 }}</ref><ref name=":0" /> NGC 4457 Is inclined by about 33°.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Vollmer|first=B.|last2=Soida|first2=M.|last3=Beck|first3=R.|last4=Chung|first4=A.|last5=Urbanik|first5=M.|last6=Chyzy|first6=K.T.|last7=Otmianowska-Mazur|first7=K.|last8=Kenney|first8=J.D.P.|date=4 April 2013|title=Large-scale radio continuum properties of 19 Virgo cluster galaxies⋆ The influence of tidal interactions, ram pressure stripping, and accreting gas envelopes|url=https://arxiv.org/pdf/1304.1279v1.pdf|journal=Astronomy & Astrophysics|volume=553|pages=38|doi=10.1051/0004-6361/201321163|via=|arxiv = 1304.1279 |bibcode = 2013A&A...553A.116V }}</ref> It was discovered by astronomer [[William Herschel]] on February 23, 1784.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://cseligman.com/text/atlas/ngc44a.htm#4457|title=New General Catalog Objects: NGC 4450 - 4499|website=cseligman.com|language=en-US|access-date=2017-08-18}}</ref> It is a member of the [[Virgo cluster of galaxies|Virgo Cluster of galaxies]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://kudzu.astr.ua.edu/devatlas/NGC_4457______B___________.html|title=NGC 4457 - (R)SAB(s)a|last=|first=|date=|website=The de Vaucouleurs Atlas of Galaxies|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ned.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/NEDatt?objname=NGC+4457|title=Detailed Object Classifications|website=ned.ipac.caltech.edu|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref>
==Physical characteristics== NGC 4457 has a broad oval zone containing an inner spiral which is defined mainly by two fairly open arms. There is a well-defined outer ring that is completely detached from the inner regions of the galaxy.<ref name=":1" />
===Truncated disk=== NGC 4457 has a severely reduced amount of [[Star formation|star-formation]] in its disk while its inner regions have a normalized rate of massive star formation.<ref name=":1" /> This may have been caused by a recent interaction of the [[Interstellar medium|gas]] in the galaxy with the [[Intracluster medium|gas]] in the surrounding [[Virgo Cluster|cluster]],<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Cortes|first=Juan R.|last2=Kenney|first2=Jeffrey D. P.|last3=Hardy|first3=Eduardo|date=24 December 2014|title=INTEGRAL-FIELD STELLAR AND IONIZED GAS KINEMATICS OF PECULIAR VIRGO CLUSTER SPIRAL GALAXIES|url=http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/0067-0049/216/1/9/pdf|journal=The Astrophysical Journal Supplement Series|volume=216:9|pages=34|via=}}</ref> causing the gas to be stripped away in effect known as [[ram-pressure stripping]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.aip.de/~rpiontek/ram.html|title=Robert A. Piontek -- Ram Pressure Stripping|website=www.aip.de|access-date=2017-08-19}}</ref>
== See also == * [[List of NGC objects (4001–5000)]] * [[Messier 90]] * [[Comet Galaxy]] - a distant galaxy in the cluster [[Abell 2667]] which is experiencing [[ram-pressure stripping]] as well
== External links == {{WikiSky}} * [http://dc.zah.uni-heidelberg.de/sasmirala/q/prod/qp/NGC%204457| Sasmirala page on NGC 4457]
